intro: Argyrocome citrina, commonly known as the yellow argyrocome, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
